title: Enacts the "New York state comprehensive information system act"
summary: Enacts the "New York state comprehensive information system act"; authorizes the state library and office for technology to coordinate the purchase of electronic databases or other information resources for state agencies, library systems and other governmental entities.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2909

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 21, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A. P. LOPEZ, MOLINARO, MONTESANO, FINCH, BARRON,
         KAVANAGH, SPANO, McDONOUGH -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A.  BARCLAY,
         CASTRO,  CORWIN, HAWLEY, KOLB, MAYERSOHN, McKEVITT, RABBITT, SALADINO,
         SAYWARD -- read once and referred to the Committee  on  Libraries  and
         Education Technology

       AN  ACT to amend the education law, in relation to authorizing the state
         library, in conjunction with the office for technology, to  coordinate
         the  purchase  of  electronic databases or other information resources
         for state agencies, libraries and other governmental entities

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Short  title. This act shall be known and may be cited as
    2  the "New  York state comprehensive information system (NYSCIS) act".
    3    S 2. Legislative findings. State agencies and  the  libraries  of  New
    4  York  individually  license  and purchase electronic databases and other
    5  information resources. Access to information is not only  vital  to  the
    6  functioning of our democracy, but also to creating an environment condu-
    7  cive  to  learning,  research  and  innovation.  The coordination of the
    8  selection and purchase of these  resources  by  the  state  library  and
    9  office  for  technology  would  result  in greater efficiencies and cost
   10  savings for the public and foster improved access to information  across
   11  the  state.  Therefore, it is in the best interests of the state and its
   12  libraries to enact the "New York state comprehensive information  system
   13  (NYSCIS) act".
   14    S  3. The education law is amended by adding a new section 286 to read
   15  as follows:
   16    S 286. NEW YORK STATE COMPREHENSIVE INFORMATION SYSTEM.   1.  GENERAL.
   17  THERE IS HEREBY ESTABLISHED THE NEW YORK STATE COMPREHENSIVE INFORMATION
   18  SYSTEM  (NYSCIS)  TO BE ADMINISTERED BY THE STATE LIBRARY IN CONJUNCTION
   19  WITH THE OFFICE FOR TECHNOLOGY,  TO  ENABLE  A  COLLABORATIVE  AND  COST

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05993-01-1

       A. 2909                             2

    1  EFFECTIVE  APPROACH  TO  THE  PROCUREMENT  OF AN ELECTRONIC DATABASE AND
    2  OTHER INFORMATION RESOURCES.
    3    2. PARTICIPANTS. ENTITIES PERMITTED TO PARTICIPATE IN NYSCIS ARE STATE
    4  AGENCIES,  LIBRARY  SYSTEMS  AND THEIR MEMBER LIBRARIES, AUTHORITIES AND
    5  OTHER LOCAL GOVERNMENTAL ENTITIES.
    6    3. STATE CONTRACTS. STATE AGENCIES ARE REQUIRED  TO  COORDINATE  THEIR
    7  PROCUREMENT  FOR INFORMATION RESOURCES THROUGH THE STATE LIBRARY AND THE
    8  OFFICE FOR TECHNOLOGY OR THEIR DESIGNEE.
    9    4. RESOURCE SELECTION. THE STATE  LIBRARY,  IN  CONJUNCTION  WITH  THE
   10  OFFICE FOR TECHNOLOGY, SHALL CREATE AN ADVISORY COMMITTEE REPRESENTATIVE
   11  OF  PARTICIPANTS  IN  THIS COLLABORATIVE EFFORT, AND WILL BE TASKED WITH
   12  THE SELECTION OF INFORMATION RESOURCES TO BE INCLUDED IN NYSCIS.
   13    5. ADMINISTRATION. THE STATE LIBRARY, IN CONJUNCTION WITH  THE  OFFICE
   14  FOR TECHNOLOGY, OR THEIR DESIGNEE SHALL ADMINISTER NYSCIS AND BE PERMIT-
   15  TED  TO  RECOUP EXPENSES FOR COORDINATING THESE COLLABORATIVE PURCHASING
   16  AGREEMENTS.
   17    S 4. This act shall take effect six months after it shall have  become
   18  a law.
